attributes.comment:
The rate increase for adoption-related fees is over 66 percent. This increase
is totally unfair to families who have paid thousands of dollars to adopt
children who need loving homes.

There are certainly other avenues for the government to make money, such as
taxing corporations and/or changing tax breaks for the wealthy. Most families
who go through the arduous process of (foreign) adoption are middle class who do
not have a luxury lifestyle.

These rates are simply unfair and need to be revisited BEFORE the suggested rate
hike is implemented. Adoption is an expensive process, and it is unconscionable
to raise fees by up to 66% for adoption-related petitions.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Jane Salinger
